title: Japan’s “five-foot giant” of international relations | Center for the Humanities

quotes: One of the most dramatic moments during Ogata’s decade as high commissioner took place on February 17, 1993, when she abruptly announced that the UNHCR would suspend the delivery of aid to desperate refugees in Bosnia-Herzegovina
As Ogata herself put it, ‘no decision that I took in my ten years as high commissioner caused as much havoc.’

organizations.name: UN Refugee Agency
quotes: UN Refugee Agency collaborate with military forces, including the U.S.-led coalition in Iraq and NATO in Yugoslavia
Her personal aide, Kazuo Tase, recalls Ogata giving a speech at the UN Refugee Agency after she had left her post.
